result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Allen J Shaw in court with attorney Eugene Loftin.  Defendant Allen J Shaw in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Plea:
14CF388:  Ct. 1 - NC.
14CF389:  Ct. 1 - G.

14CM2601:  DRI.

Bond from DRI files is to be applied to 14CF388 and 14CF389.

Def req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Defendant to be held without bond pending sentencing.
Stipulation and Order for Consolidation - forwarded to Judge Marik for signature

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, school at Park High School, attending New Omega Church on Tuesday and Sunday, and meeting with atty.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Allen J Shaw in court with attorney Eugene Loftin.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
13CF1694 is set for JT on 2/25.  Agreement has been reached, but Defense req adj to condolidate CM matters.
BTC:  2/25 will be PLEAH.

State req bond mod.
BTC:  Bond mod to $10,000 cash on each file.

Defendant Allen J Shaw in court with attorney Kathleen R Lang.  Defendant Allen J Shaw in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The deft's family can pay about $2,000.00 and deft's mother indicated to Ms. Lang that she would be willing to co-sign a bond but she is not in court today. The State indicates that they feel the bonds in these cases are set too low and objects to any further modifications. The State cites the defendant's new charges came about while deft was house arrest.

BTC: Bond modification is denied
